intro: Neobartsia flava subsp. minor, commonly known as the yellow bartsia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The subspecies minor is distinguished by its smaller stature and more delicate floral structures compared to the main species.
